question:
Consider the following statements about Lucknow Pact of 1916:
  1. The pact was a joint session of INC and Muslim League
  2. The session was presided over by Ambica Charan Majumdar
  3. Moderates and extremists once again united during the session
   Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation:
All given statements are correct
The Lucknow pact was a joint session between Indian National Congress and Muslim league in 1916. The session was presided over by Ambica Charan Majumdar. Moderates and extremists one again united during the session due to efforts of Annie Besant. In this session, both congress and Muslim league signed a pact in which few things were added without considering their consequences. These included a proposal to give one-third representation to Muslims in central government; separate electorates for communities; system of weight age for minority representation etc.
